poem:
**Promise of Turbulence**

in the garden of nations—  
bloomed strikes  
the distant hum  
of engines,  
whispers of oil  
in the weathered field  
  
each flare of flame  
a petal  
falling—  
until the air  
is pregnant with  
unseen rain,  
a global tremor  
settling in   
like dust  
gathering on untouched fruit.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US strikes on Iran could damage global growth, says IMF chief US strikes on Iran could damage global economic growth, the head of the International Monetary Fund has warned. Director Kristalina Georgieva told Bloomberg TV that the IMF was watching energy prices closely, warning a rise in oil prices could have a ripple effect throughout the global economy. “There could be secondary and tertiary impacts,” she said. “Let’s say there is more turbulence that goes". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
